understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a private method named journalSerializer() which returns a Serializer object. It checks if a member variable _journalSerializer is not null, it returns that object, otherwise it creates and returns a new JavaSerializer object.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to configuration in the sense that it is responsible for providing a Serializer object that will be used in the creation of a Prevayler instance. The method decides which Serializer implementation to use based on the value of the _journalSerializer member variable, which can be set through configuration methods elsewhere in the code.

understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a private method named journalSerializer() that returns a Serializer object. It checks if a member variable _journalSerializer is not null, it returns that object, otherwise it returns a new JavaSerializer object.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to configuration as it is responsible for determining which Serializer object to use. It checks if a custom Serializer object is provided (_journalSerializer) and uses it if available, otherwise it falls back to using a default JavaSerializer object. This method is crucial for configuring the serialization behavior of the system.

config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration is used as a parameter when creating a Prevayler instance in the create() method. It is passed to the PrevaylerImpl constructor along with other parameters.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration is triggered whenever a new Prevayler instance is created, which typically happens when the system starts up or when a new Prevayler instance is needed.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration option on the system is related to how transactions are handled and copied within the Prevayler instance. Depending on the value set for _transactionDeepCopyMode, it can affect the memory usage and performance of the system.
